greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of f(-x) / f(-x^3) in powers of x where f() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(1/12) eta(q) / eta(q^3) in powers of q.
Given g.f. A(x) then B(q) = A(q^6)^2 / q satisfies 0 = f(B(q), B(q^2), B(q^4)) where f(u, v, w) = 4*v^2 + (u^2 - v) * (w^2 + v).
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (432 t)) = 3^(1/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A000726.
Convolution square is A112157. Convolution 4th power is A058095. - _Michael Somos_, Oct 08 2015
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x] / QPochhammer[ x^3], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Oct 08 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x, x^3] QPochhammer[ x^2, x^3], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Oct 08 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A) / eta(x^3 + A), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jan 26 2008
